page.title: 09Fishing on the Solway Firth
page.content: The{haaf net}fishermen use a beam and net.The beam is 16 feet long and is made from very strong wood. The fishermen go out to the channel in the{Solway}where they draw position to fish. This is done by building small heaps of sand, one for each man. One fisherman turns his back while the rest select a pile each. He is then given the signal to turn round and kick out one of the piles of sand. The man who owns this pile of sand has the first choice of position, and so on. The men then stand in a line across the channel facing the flow of water and the fish swim into the net. The fisherman must be careful when fishing the{incoming tide}(known as the flood) because the water runs fast through different channels in the sand.
